lines.text: ...Well, no. We already know Flesh to Stone <c=#0000FF>backfired</c> on the Stop Wizard, so...
It wouldn't have made him a statue, no.
Also, rock doesn't burn, so that's a double whammy in terms of stuff-what-couldn't-happen.
Well, hang on- I don't know exactly what it looks like when that spell backfires!
Maybe it starts turning the target to stone, which traps them in place for a little bit, before it reverses course.
In fact- we don't even have to say that much! Maybe the spell was in progress, but because it trapped him in fire...
He caught on fire during the spell's duration!
I mean, I'm used to all of your ideas bein' total claptrap, is the thing.
Wow. Thanks for the vote of confidence.
Still, I don't know about that. Relies a lot on assumin' the spell has a <c=#FF00FF>cast time.</c>
That book say anything about that?
...And you're usually supposed to take that to mean it's instant.
Hm. Could be the book just got sloppy and didn't mention it, but...
There's gotta be a <c=#FF00FF>simpler way</c> to keep the guy from movin'.
